intro: Leucas somalensis, commonly known as Somali leucas, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Somalia and neighboring countries. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, arranged in whorled clusters, and bloom during the rainy season. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots and a capacity to store water in its tissues.
